official-title.#text:
To protect consumers from discriminatory State taxes on
		  motor vehicle rentals.

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the following
			 bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text:
End Discriminatory State Taxes for
			 Automobile Renters Act of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

The purpose of this Act is to prohibit
			 prospectively, and provide a remedy for tax discrimination by a State or
			 Locality against the rental of motor vehicles.

term.#tail:
means valuation for a property tax levied by a
			 taxing district. The term

means a
			 geographical area in a State or Locality used in determining the assessed value
			 of property for ad valorem taxation.

text.#text:
The
			 term

term.#tail:
means property, other than motor vehicle rental property and
			 land used primarily for agricultural purposes or timber growing, devoted to a
			 commercial or industrial use, and subject to a property tax levy.

text.#text: The term
The term

A tax discriminates against the rental of
			 motor vehicles if a State or Locality imposes the tax on, or with respect
			 to—

the rental of motor vehicles but not on, or
			 with respect to, the rental of more than 51 percent of the rentals of other
			 tangible personal property rented within the State or Locality, or

the rental of motor vehicles at a tax rate
			 that exceeds the tax rate generally applicable to at least 51 percent of the
			 rentals of other tangible personal property within the same State or
			 Locality.

A tax discriminates against the business of
			 renting motor vehicles if a State or Locality imposes the tax on, or with
			 respect to—

the business of renting motor vehicles but
			 not on, or with respect to, the business of more than 51 percent of the other
			 commercial and industrial taxpayers within the State or Locality, on the same
			 tax base as the State or Locality employs with respect to the business of
			 renting motor vehicles, or

the business of
			 renting motor vehicles, at a tax rate that exceeds the tax rate generally
			 applicable to the business of more than 51 percent of the other commercial and
			 industrial taxpayers within the State or Local jurisdiction.

A tax discriminates against motor vehicle
			 rental property if a State or Locality—

assesses motor
			 vehicle rental property at a value that has a higher ratio to the true market
			 value of the property than the ratio that the assessed value of other
			 commercial and industrial property of the same type in the same assessment
			 jurisdiction has to the true market value of the other commercial and
			 industrial property,

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: End Discriminatory State Taxes for Automobile Renters Act of 2013/s:3/ss:c/p:3/sp:A

text.#text:
levies or collects
			 a tax on an assessment that may not be made under

levies or collects
			 an ad valorem property tax on motor vehicle rental property at a tax rate that
			 exceeds the tax rate applicable to commercial and industrial property in the
			 same assessment jurisdiction.

term.#tail:
mean a political subdivision of any State, or any governmental entity or person
			 acting on behalf of such Locality, and with the authority to impose, levy or
			 collect taxes.

does not include any charge imposed

Except as otherwise specifically provided

of a tax imposed on a per unit basis is the unit.

text.#text: The term

term.#text:
tax rate generally applicable to other
			 commercial and industrial taxpayers

text.#text: The term

header.#text:
Tax rate
			 generally applicable to other commercial and industrial

text.#text:
the tax rate

			 their customers, or

the unweighted

No State or Locality may
			 levy or collect a discriminatory tax on the rental of motor vehicles, the
			 business of renting motor vehicles, or motor vehicle rental property.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, or the
			 constitution or laws of any State, the district courts of the United States
			 shall have jurisdiction, without regard to amount in controversy or citizenship
			 of the parties, to grant such mandatory or prohibitive injunctive relief,
			 interim equitable relief, and declaratory judgments as may be necessary to
			 prevent, restrain or terminate any acts in violation of this Act, except that
			 such jurisdiction shall not be exclusive of the jurisdiction which any Federal
			 or State court may have in the absence of this section.

text.#text:
Notwithstanding
			 any provision of

The burden of proof in any proceeding brought under this
			 Act shall be upon the party seeking relief and shall be by a preponderance of
			 the evidence on all issues of fact.

In
			 granting relief against a tax which is imposed in violation of section 4, the
			 court shall strike the tax in its entirety, unless the court finds the
			 tax—

is the equivalent
			 of a specific tax imposed on at least 51 percent of other commercial and
			 industrial taxpayers, and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, the
			 burden of proof on the issue of whether a tax is the equivalent of a tax
			 imposed on other commercial and industrial taxpayers shall be on the State or
			 Locality that imposes the tax.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: End Discriminatory State Taxes for Automobile Renters Act of 2013/s:5/ss:b

text.#text:
is not discriminatory in effect. If such
			 tax is discriminatory in effect with respect to tax rate or amount only, the
			 court shall strike only the discriminatory or excessive portion of the tax as
			 determined by the court. Notwithstanding

An action to
			 enforce the provisions of this Act may be brought only by a person who—

rents motor
			 vehicles to another person,

is engaged in the
			 business of renting motor vehicles,

owns motor vehicle
			 rental property, or

rents a motor
			 vehicle from another person.

A
			 person who rents a motor vehicle from another person and is seeking relief
			 under this Act may only bring a cause of action against the State or Locality
			 imposing the discriminatory tax as defined by this Act.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
to State or Local taxation that would be
			 prohibited in the absence of this Act.

text.#text:
This Act shall not be construed to
			 constitute the consent of

The provisions of this Act shall become effective on the
			 date of the enactment of this Act.

Discriminatory
			 taxes as defined by this Act are not prohibited under this Act if—

State or Local legislative authorization
			 for a discriminatory tax that is in effect as of the date of the enactment of
			 this Act, does not lapse, the tax rate does not increase and the tax base for
			 such tax does not change; or

a State enacts legislation by the date of
			 the enactment of this Act—

that specifically
			 authorizes a Locality to impose a discriminatory tax;

the Locality
			 imposes the authorized tax within five years from the date the State enacted
			 the authorization for the Local tax; and

the tax rate
			 imposed by the Locality is not increased and the tax base for such tax does not
			 change.
